Activity: Check emails and system notifications. Review the previous day's test results and identify areas that require further investigation.
Prioritize and retest critical bugs that block further testing. Communicate with developers to ensure bugs are addressed promptly. @CDEV-1, @CDEV-2, @CDEV-3 Bug priority check.
Execute test cases focused on UI elements and user interface. Document any issues with menu navigation, text display, or input controls. @UIUX-1 Need some support on the UI part.
Begin performance testing. Monitor frame rates, memory usage, and load times during gameplay. Document any performance bottlenecks or areas of concern.
Conduct stress tests by simulating high player loads or intense combat scenarios. Monitor the game's stability and identify any potential crashes or errors.
Perform ad-hoc testing, focusing on level design and environmental interactions. Look for collision issues, invisible walls, or areas where players can get stuck.
Analyze performance test results. Identify the root cause of performance bottlenecks and propose potential optimizations. @LPRO-1 Performance test results are out. Let's take a look.
Summarize testing progress. Prepare a daily report outlining the number of test cases executed, the number of bugs found, and any significant observations.
